name: Arabic Alphabet
subtitle: Basic Letters
arabic: أ ب ت ث ج ح خ د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ع غ ف ق ك ل م ن هـ و ي
description: Learn the basic Arabic alphabet. Each letter has a unique sound and shape.

name: Letter Forms
subtitle: Beginning, Middle, End
description: Arabic letters change shape depending on their position in the word.
notes: Notice how the letter "ب" connects differently.

name: Short Vowels (Harakat)
subtitle: Fatha, Kasra, Damma
description: Short vowels are marks above or below letters that change their sound.

name: Long Vowels (Madd)
subtitle: Alif, Waw, Ya
description: Long vowels are formed by adding Alif, Waw, or Ya after the letter.

name: Tanween
subtitle: Nunation
description: Tanween is the addition of double vowels at the end of a word.
notes: Tanween sounds like an extra "n" at the end.

name: Sukoon
subtitle: Silent Letters
description: Sukoon indicates that the letter is pronounced without a vowel.
notes: The letter with sukoon is silent or quickly joined.

name: Shaddah
subtitle: Double Letters
description: Shaddah means the letter is pronounced twice (with emphasis).
notes: Hold the letter sound for a moment longer.

name: Laam Shamsiyyah & Qamariyyah
subtitle: Sun & Moon Letters
description: Learn the difference between sun and moon letters when "Al" is used.
notes: Sun letters assimilate the "L" sound, moon letters do not.

name: Qalqalah
subtitle: Echoing Letters
description: Qalqalah letters are pronounced with a slight echo or bounce.
notes: Bounce the sound at the end of the letter.

name: Noon Sakinah & Tanween Rules
subtitle: Izhar, Idgham, Iqlab, Ikhfa
description: Rules for pronouncing Noon Sakinah and Tanween with different letters.
notes: Each rule changes the sound of Noon or Tanween.

name: Meem Sakinah Rules
subtitle: Ikhfa Shafawi, Idgham Shafawi, Izhar Shafawi
description: Rules for pronouncing Meem Sakinah with different letters.
notes: Pay attention to the letter after Meem Sakinah.

name: Madd (Elongation) Rules
subtitle: Types of Madd
description: Learn the different types of elongation (Madd) in Quranic recitation.
notes: Some Madds are stretched for 2, 4, or 6 counts.

name: Waqf (Stopping) Signs
subtitle: Pause & Stop Marks
description: Learn the symbols used for stopping or pausing during recitation.
notes: Follow the signs to pause or continue as needed.

name: Practice Words
subtitle: Combining Rules
description: Practice reading words that combine multiple rules.
notes: Apply all previous rules while reading.

name: Practice Sentences
subtitle: Applied Reading
description: Practice reading full sentences from the Quran.
notes: Read fluently and apply all rules.
